leitej.thread

Class PoolAgnosticThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • leitej.thread.PoolAgnosticThread

  • public final class PoolAgnosticThread
extends java.lang.Object
    Pool of Agnostic Thread

    This class provides a pool of threads that extend AgnosticThread.
    You can get pools by setting the maximum and minimum numbers of threads running simultaneously in this pool.

    The constructor will put a call to closeAsync() in the ShutdownHookUtil.add(InvokeItf).
    Author:
    Julio Leite
    See Also:
    XThreadData, ThreadData

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_MAX_NUM_THREAD
      Default maximum threads running on the pool.
      static int DEFAULT_MIN_NUM_THREAD
      Default minimum threads running on the pool.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      Closes the pool and wait only for the already started invokes to execute.
      All other registered invokes will be ignored and not executed.
      void closeAsync()
      Closes the pool asynchronously.
      void closeWaitAll()
      Closes the pool and wait for all registered invokes to execute.
      void executionerJob()
      Give tasks to threads waiting for it.
      This method is only to be internally invoked by the thread executioner.
      static boolean isCurrentThreadFrom(PoolAgnosticThread pool)
      Use this method to know if the thread calling it is from the pool in argument.
      static PoolAgnosticThread newInstance()
      Call this method to get a new PoolAgnosticThread instance.
      The new pool will have DEFAULT_MIN_NUM_THREAD and DEFAULT_MAX_NUM_THREAD.

      A call to closeAsync() is put in the ShutdownHookUtil.add(InvokeItf).
      static PoolAgnosticThread newInstance(int minNumThread, int maxNumThread)
      Call this method to get a new PoolAgnosticThread instance.
      The pool will have minNumThread and maxNumThread in parameters.

      A call to closeAsync() is put in the ShutdownHookUtil.add(InvokeItf).
      void normalizerJob()
      Certify the stability of the pool.
      This method is only to be internally invoked by the thread normaliser.
      void rescuerJob()
      Recover threads that end his task.
      This method is only to be internally invoked by the thread rescuer.
      void workOn(XThreadData xThreadData)
      Adds work to the queue of the pool.

      • newInstance

        public static PoolAgnosticThread newInstance()

        The new pool will have DEFAULT_MIN_NUM_THREAD and DEFAULT_MAX_NUM_THREAD.

        A call to closeAsync() is put in the ShutdownHookUtil.add(InvokeItf).
        Returns:
        the new PoolAgnosticThread instance

      • newInstance

        public static PoolAgnosticThread newInstance(int minNumThread,
                                             int maxNumThread)
        Call this method to get a new PoolAgnosticThread instance.
        The pool will have minNumThread and maxNumThread in parameters.

        A call to closeAsync() is put in the ShutdownHookUtil.add(InvokeItf).
        Parameters:
        minNumThread - defines minimum threads running on the pool
        maxNumThread - defines maximum threads running on the pool
        Returns:
        the new PoolAgnosticThread instance

        public static boolean isCurrentThreadFrom(PoolAgnosticThread pool)
        Use this method to know if the thread calling it is from the pool in argument.
        Parameters:
        pool - to verify
        Returns:
        boolean

      • closeWaitAll

        public void closeWaitAll()
                  throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Closes the pool and wait for all registered invokes to execute.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - to stop the waits until finished

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Closes the pool and wait only for the already started invokes to execute.
        All other registered invokes will be ignored and not executed.
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException - to stop the waits until finished

      • closeAsync

        public void closeAsync()
        Closes the pool asynchronously.

      • normalizerJob

        public void normalizerJob()
        Certify the stability of the pool.
        This method is only to be internally invoked by the thread normaliser.

      • executionerJob

        public void executionerJob()
                    throws ClosedLtRtException
        Give tasks to threads waiting for it.
        This method is only to be internally invoked by the thread executioner.
        Throws:
        ClosedLtRtException

      • workOn

        public void workOn(XThreadData xThreadData)
            throws PoolAgnosticThreadLtException,
                   SeppukuLtRtException,
                   IllegalArgumentLtRtException
        Adds work to the queue of the pool.
        Parameters:
        xThreadData - a XThreadData object specifying the work to be done.
        Throws:
        PoolAgnosticThreadLtException - if the pool has already closed.
        SeppukuLtRtException - exit(420) if encounters the control thread of the pool not alive
        IllegalArgumentLtRtException - if xThreadData parameter is null
